snippet: The justices’ questions suggest some favor striking down overall limits for individual contributions to federal candidates and political party committees.
abstract: Supreme Court seems prepared to strike down part of federal campaign finance law left intact by its decision in Citizens United in 2010; justices’ questions suggest some favor striking down overall limits for individual contributions to federal candidates and political party committees.
lead_paragraph: The justices’ questions suggest some favor striking down overall limits for individual contributions to federal candidates and political party committees.

headline.main: Supreme Court Again Weighs Spending Limits in Campaigns
headline.print_headline: Supreme Court Again Weighs Spending Limits In Campaigns

keywords.value: Citizens United v Federal Election Commission (Supreme Court Decision)
keywords.name: subject
